doc:
Jean-Claude Fourneau https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jean-Claude_Fourneau 0 Jean-Claude Fourneau (28 March 1907 – 9 October 1981) was a French painter close to the surrealist movement. His mother was a descendant of Victor de Lanneau, restorer of the Collège Sainte-Barbe in Paris, of Juliette Adam, founder of a French paper, La Nouvelle Revue, muse of Léon Gambetta and the spiritual mother of Pierre Loti; and she was the daughter of Paul Segond, pioneer in the field of surgical gynaecology. His father, Ernest Fourneau, was the founder of French medicinal chemistry. Jean-Claude_Fourneau ( 28_March_1907 – 9_October_1981 ) was a_French_painter_close to the_surrealist_movement . His_mother was a_descendant of Victor de Lanneau , restorer of the_Collège_Sainte-Barbe in Paris , of Juliette_Adam , founder of a_French_paper , La_Nouvelle_Revue , muse of Léon_Gambetta and the_spiritual_mother of Pierre_Loti ; and she was the_daughter of Paul_Segond , pioneer in the_field of surgical_gynaecology . His_father , Ernest_Fourneau , was the_founder of French_medicinal_chemistry .
